summary: Tested 3 P1 features: Reminder System Override UI, Conflict Detection UI, and Network Creation Telegram Notification. All 14 backend tests passed. Fixed 2 frontend bugs: 1) AlertsPage using wrong API import (reportsAPI vs v3ReportsAPI), 2) NetworkSettingsTab parsing API response incorrectly.

backend_reminder_config: GET reminder-config includes global_default with interval_days
PUT reminder-config with custom interval_days returns 200
PUT reminder-config reset to global works
backend_conflicts: GET conflicts with network_id filter works
GET conflicts structure valid if any exist
frontend_ui: Alert Center shows Alerts and SEO Conflicts tabs
Conflicts tab shows stats (Total, Critical, High Priority)
Conflicts tab shows empty state when no conflicts
Settings tab visible in GroupDetailPage after Managers tab
Optimization Reminders section shows enable toggle
Use Global Default toggle works - shows custom interval when OFF
Custom interval input appears when Use Global is disabled
Save button saves settings with success toast
Reset to Global button appears when custom is set

bugs_fixed.issue: Wrong API import: used 'reportsAPI' instead of 'v3ReportsAPI' for getConflicts()
bugs_fixed.fix: Changed import from 'reportsAPI' to 'v3ReportsAPI' and updated function call

bugs_fixed.issue: Incorrect API response parsing - tried to read flat fields from nested structure
bugs_fixed.fix: Updated loadSettings() to properly read from global_default and network_override objects

critical_code_review_comments: Good: Settings tab is placed after Managers tab as specified
Good: Reminder config API properly separates global_default and network_override
Good: Conflicts API returns structured data with severity breakdown
Good: All interactive elements have data-testid attributes for testing
Good: Empty state shows 'No Conflicts Detected' with green checkmark
seed_data_creation: Reminder config was set to custom 5 days during testing, then reset to global
context_for_next_testing_agent: P1 features testing complete. Key points: 1) Network Settings tab with reminder override is under GroupDetailPage.jsx, uses NetworkSettingsTab.jsx component. 2) Conflicts tab is in Alert Center page (AlertsPage.jsx), calls v3ReportsAPI.getConflicts(). 3) Network ID for testing: 76e067db-60ba-4e3b-a949-b3229dc1c652. 4) Two bugs were fixed in this iteration - wrong API import in AlertsPage and incorrect response parsing in NetworkSettingsTab.
